hypothesis_content.title: Stablecoin Pair Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the BTC/ETH pair experiences 5-day realized volatility below its 20th percentile while funding rates remain neutral (±0.005%), an impending volatility expansion will create directional momentum suitable for pairs breakout trading with 2:1 reward/risk profile.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility in correlated assets often precede significant moves as pent-up order flow executes. Neutral funding rates indicate lack of speculative positioning extremes. The BTC dominance filter ensures both assets have sufficient market attention. Breakout thresholds based on statistical likelyhood of false breakouts.
entry_conditions: 5-day realized volatility of BTC/ETH ratio < 20th percentile (30-day lookback)
Perpetual funding rates for both BTC and ETH between -0.005% and +0.005%
Enter long the outperformer when ratio breaks 5-day high/low by 1.5%
Stop placed at 0.75% beyond entry point
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of breakouts are false (reverse to stop loss), or volatility remains compressed beyond 7 days in >50% of signals.
